FuncDef:
The link protection-type command configures the type of protection for a GMPLS UNI tunnel.
The undo link protection-type command restores the default type of protection.
By default, rerouting is used for GMPLS UNI tunnel protection.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets the type of protection for a GMPLS UNI tunnel to unprotected. This means that no protection is provided.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
At present, protection switching on a transport network needs to be manually triggered, and protection paths need to be manually configured. These manual operations increase carriers' operation and maintenance expenditure. GMPLS UNI provides flexible link protection and recovery means for transport networks. It enables a transport network to quickly detect faults from end to end and perform protection switching and to dynamically create protection paths. Carriers' operation and maintenance expenditure then can be reduced.
When using the link protection-type command to configure a GMPLS UNI protection mode, take the network bandwidth conditions into consideration.
Prerequisites
A GMPLS UNI tunnel has been created using the gmpls-tunnel command.
Precautions
You only need to run the link protection-type command in the GMPLS UNI tunnel view on the ingress EN.
